summary: Many federal agencies must report their spending data on USAspending.gov to help the government—and the public—track federal funds. In this Q&A report, we found that 49 agencies didn't report data to USAspending.gov. And neither Treasury nor the Office of Management and Budget have clear responsibility to determine which agencies should report. Also, some agencies reported amounts of COVID-19 spending to the website that didn't match...
title: Federal Spending Transparency: Opportunities to Improve USAspending.gov Data
